Posts.Content: Hi, Ann! I was diagnosed with non-invasive and invasive ductile carcinoma Grade 3 after a lumpectomy in October 2002. Pathology reported some margins of the tumor were missing. Further surgery with chemo/radiation were advised. I was not a candidate for mammosite radiation due to the proximity of the tumor to my skin. I chose not to further cut, poison, or burn my body and wanted to find a different way to solve the problem. In the past my husband and I have known about various remedies out there for cancer. I do not fear cancer, although I have a healthy respect for it and what it can do. My goal was to find a way to overcome my problem without maiming my body. I attended two of Dr. Birdsall's seminars and was encouraged. I kept CTCA as an option to use and was prepared to go to Zion in January. In the meantime, I quite miraculously learned of glyconutrients and what they have done for many people in dire straits. My thought was, if it can happen for someone else, why not for me? For the last year, I have been using these natural substances to help my body fight the cancer and repair my body. One thing I was lacking was a way to document my progress. In November we were in Mexico where again, quite providentially, I met a nutritionist from London who specializes in cancer therapy. She told me of a blood test developed in Russia which she has used for the last 18 months that conclusively shows whether you have any active cancer in your body and what risk you have to develop further cancers. She does not believe in leaving such things to guesswork. I learned my results yesterday. All my active cancer is gone. I do have other issues going on in my body which she will help me address so that I do not develop cancer again. She says the good news is that there is a way to fix things. I am so thankful to God for this help and for someone like her with the tenacity to find an answer to a problem when others would give up. My nutritionist in London wants to bring this information to this country and hopes to talk to the people at Zion as well. Virtually no one over here knows about this technology and some of the things she has found that repair the body in addition to glyconutrients. Thousands of research papers have been written about glycobiology. MIT has called it one of the ten technologies that will change the world, similar to computers making typewriters obsolete. You can learn more at www.glycoscience.com. If you would like to know more, please contact me. I wish you all the best in your personal fight. I do believe there is an answer. Marilyn

Posts.Content: Jewel--I, too, have been told, blood tests for tumor markers are not all that reliable. My nutritionist wholeheartedly agrees. The blood test from Russia, however, has been very reliable. Certainly knowing where you stand is infinitely more desirable than "watching for signs of anything returning" which would certainly put one at a disadvantage in conquering the enemy. The blood sample is handled differently in that no centrifuge is used and it must remain absolutely still for one hour before transport. As far as treatment is concerned, I suppose that differs from case to case. The nutritionist endeavors to correct basic systemic problems, not just treat symptoms, through, of course, diet and other means she has found which work to bring the body back into balance. The key words here are "work" and "balance." To date I am unable to give you my personal testimony since I have only begun the process. I am looking forward to the day which she has told me will come when I will be a "new woman." At 52, that sounds wonderful. I am anticipating the journey. The best way to get your answers is to talk with her directly. If you would give me your phone number, I will pass it on to her. She has told me she would be glad to call you. I know it is worth it. Marilyn
